p:
Chemical parameters defined under EU Regulation [ 5] to classify the quality of olive oil were analyzed: free acidity (% of oleic acid), peroxide value (mEq O 2 kg −1 oil), and UV absorption characteristics (K
232 , K
270 , and ΔK) were analyzed following the procedure described by European Union Commission [ 5]. UV absorption indexes were measured using cyclohexane, in a UV–visible spectrophotometer (Helios Gamma model, UVG 1002E; Helios, Cambridge, UK) and 10 mm quartz cuvettes.
